text: No more flowers, just earth, wood and bones.

The collection of exotic fauna for private menageries is an established market - the curious will pay to see them. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Once hunted, the creatures are stored in pens and cages for spectators or potential buyers. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Busy, noisy markets of the rich and powerful, where buyers vie for ownership of their exotic beasts. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
A gem mineshaft is for digging into the mountains in search of precious stones, something Dwarfs are very good at.  [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Gem mines are valuable resources, especially if they have a high yield.  [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Members of the Gemcutters' Guild are respected both for their craft and for the riches they create.   [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
There are always those without any formal medical training, who know older ways and which herbs will cure which ills. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
For herbs that prove difficult to acquire, growing them artificially is the answer. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Alchemists study not just what herbs interact with what substance, but why, and then record the lore in tomes for antiquity. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Volcanic ore is quite rare, and a precious resource for most due to the way it can interact with certain magic lores. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Items, such as talismans, made from obsidian often hold arcane power, and so those skilled in its manufacture are widely sought. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
To be skilled at carving obsidian is to be skilled in sigils and symbols of power, for obsidian soaks in the ensorcelled. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Strange, exotic - even sensuous - smells fill the air at this market. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Gathered from the far flung east, spices from many foreign realms can be traded here. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Races from the east come to trade and bring with them exotic wares and spices. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Deep in the red pits can be found mercury in the raw form of cinnabar. A material often used in Dark Magic rituals. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
The Blood Mines are red as cinnabar - and occasionally Warpstone - are found here in significant seams. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Best not choose the dark green powder, though, it certainly isn't snuff! [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
To hunt here is to become the hunted, for the prey is vicious and probably dead already… [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Should the smallfolk organise themselves, a whole expedition will venture into the haunted woods in search of game. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
What is the Flayer? A myth, but one that is all too real. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Gold found here is always tarnished and far from the pure element so beloved by Dwarfs. Nevertheless, it has value. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
When a Vampire Count discovers a large seam of gold, he will send his minions forth to scour it clean. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
A great furnace with an ornate, brazen face, and yellow-green balefire within its sneering mouth. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
The blackest iron ore can be found in the deepest pits, underneath the mountains upon which gothic castles perch. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Since before the building of Nagashizzar, Necromancers have used Zombies to burrow and mine mountains for their minerals. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Cursed iron ore is laced with Warpstone. Such mines are prized. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Burning with balefire, an unholy forge is a relic of Stirland's more prosperous days, now defiled and used by a Vampire's thralls. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
The dread castles of Sylvania are made from stone shaped by stone cutters, under von Carstein's thrall. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
There is an art to creating a memorable tombstone or grand mausoleum. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Some gargoyles are fashioned by sculptors - others just appear, as if they flew there themselves. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
The low-born of Sylvania that have heartbeats must still make a living. Most do in the cursed fields, tending to withering crops. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Sylvanian peasants tend to wretched farms, continuing the pretence that the realm's nobles are kind and generous lords.  [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
At night, the mill by the blood-clotted streams begins to turn, mixing grains with grinded bone. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Beneath the blood-clotted streams and rank sewage are pits of dense, dark clay. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Using the raw clay compound, urn makers create opulent vessels to carry the ashes of powerful beings. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Perhaps there is some spirit trapped within, burning in abject agony every time the kilns are lit? [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Stagnant ponds can be found by their disgusting reek, the brackish water full of brine and other things… [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
The only thing that rises from the crumbling salt marshes of Sylvania are bony hands reaching toward the sky. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Deep in the dead marches are salt pans, containing piles and piles of bones, bleached and scoured white. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Foresting in Hunger Wood or the Spider Haunts is surely a fool's job? [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Once part of Stirland's burgeoning timber industry, the sawmills have remained in a ruined, yet operational state since the Vampire Wars… [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
From the ruined sawmills, Zombie bearers transport their cursed loads to large sheds long-thought abandoned by mortals.   [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
There is a cabin in the woods, you know, where darkness dwells eternally… [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
When a Vampire drinks an "aged red" from a wine glass, chances are it hasn't been made from grapes… [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
Sylvanian orchards contain low-hanging, spooky trees, whose thorny branches are as likely to grab a passer-by as provide fruit. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
The Vampire Counts crave the illusion that they are nobles, and so they bottle their own "special" vintages. [PH - Change to match faction if needed]
